sentences.sentence: They didn't even manage to come to an agreement on how to tackle the external dimension of migration, despite the fact that reaching agreements with non-EU countries is the approach that has more consensus among member states.

A lo largo de estas cinco o seis horas que hemos tenido de debate sobre la migración, no me ha dejado de sorprender la ceguera de algunos en el sentido de no reconocer la necesidad de incorporar la dimensión Budapest and Warsaw are unhappy with the asylum agreement reached between EU countries early in June, which means that member states must share the burden of migrants more fairly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: France remains very tense in some urban areas after a third night of rioting since police shot dead a teenager in a suburb of Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And as our correspondent Annelies Borge reports, the government is struggling to respond.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Despite a heavy presence of police across France on Thursday night, this is the scene here in the French capital on Friday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This is one of the many shops in this area that has been looted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Some 600 people have been detained across the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: 40,000 police officers have been deployed. But the French government continues to scramble to come up with a response to the escalation in violence. The French president Emmanuel Macron is said to be returning early from that EU summit in Brussels. He will hold a crisis meeting this afternoon. And authorities continue to appeal for calm. For those calls have not been heeded by a large part of the population in suburbs who say the killing of Nael, the 17-year-old who was shot by police on Tuesday, just revives, reignites old grievances among a population that says they have been discriminated against for generations. They feel they are the victims of police brutality, police harassment, and that now that they have the country's attention, they will continue taking to the streets to voice their anger. And they say they hope that that anger can be translated into change for future generations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Anneliese Borges in Paris for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Inflation in the Eurozone has fallen again, but it's unlikely to ease high prices for food and goods any time soon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The year-on-year rate was 5.5 percent in June, down from 6.1% in May and continuing the declining trend seen in recent months. Despite the fall, the cost of everyday items remains stubbornly high in Europe compared with other Western economies. It's been fuelled by higher energy and labour costs and Russia's war in Ukraine. Worryingly for Eurozone financial chiefs, core inflation, which strips out food and fuel prices, has risen slightly from 5.3 to 5.4 percent. That signals the ECB will likely have to continue its policy of raising interest rates again as it struggles to hit its target inflation rate of 2 percent. The ECB has raised rates eight times in a row from minus 0.5% to 3.5% and at least one more hike is expected.

Gaultier, who is on his way out at PSG but still under contract, denied accusations that he made racist and Islamophobic remarks when he was in charge of French club Nice.
